author: VNExplorer
title: Russia Blocked Deal to Give Ukraine New Weapons
text:
A Ukrainian pilot poses stands in front of a MIG-29 fighter jet on August 1, 2023 in eastern Ukraine. An official from a Ukrainian weapons company accused Russia of sabotaging a deal that would have brought fighter jets to Ukraine.
A Ukrainian defense industry official has accused Russia of interfering with the negotiated sale of fighter jets from another country.
During an interview last week with the Ukrainian website Economic Truth, Vladislav Belbas, director of Ukrainian Armored, claimed Moscow had sabotaged a deal in place with an unnamed country for an unspecified number of aircraft to be used in the war against Russia.
Ukrainian Armored is a privately-held company that specializes in manufacturing armored vehicles and weapons for the Ukrainian military. The company also works to procure arms from other nations for Ukraine.In August, an investigation by The New York Times found Ukrainian Armored had become the biggest private arms supplier in Ukraine during the war with Russia.
Yet, despite Ukrainian Armoredâ€™s financial resources, Belbas said the company was not able to complete at least one deal for fighter jets after Russian officials intervened.
â€œIn one country on the other side of the planet, we found fighter jets and began negotiating a purchase,â€ Belbas told Economic Truth. â€œThe seller was ready, and the Ministry of Defense confirmed they were needed. Suddenly, one of the letters about this agreement fell into the hands of the Russians.â€
Belbas continued: â€œVery soon, a representative of the Russian embassy in this country began walking around with this letter and threatening local officials that Russia would shut down any projects for this country. In the end, the deal broke down because the supplier country changed its mind about offering these fighters.â€
Newsweek reached out to the ministries of foreign affairs for Ukraine and Russia via email on Thursday for comment.
Belbas didnâ€™t name the country where the alleged deal fell apart, but the Kyiv Post on Thursday said Russian military bloggers and commentators have claimed the other country involved could have been Peru, and the jets being sought after were MiG-29s.
The Kyiv Post also noted that a Voice of America report from January 2023 detailed efforts by the United States to obtain weapons from Latin American countries for Ukraine. According to the report, the plan would see these countries trade Soviet-era weapons, which Ukrainian troops could begin using right away, for more modern U.S. equipment.
During the interview with Economic Truth, Belbas also discussed other ways in which Russia has managed to undermine Ukraineâ€™s defense industry. He said perhaps the â€œbiggest bottleneckâ€ in terms of ammunition production was Russia sabotaging Ukraineâ€™s ability to make gunpowder.
â€œThere is no gunpowder production in Ukraine, and it is impractical to build such a plant during the war,â€ Belbas said. â€œAs soon as such a plant appears, the Russians will destroy it.â€
Related Articles

author: RedacciÃ³n
title: Cher solicitÃ³ la tutela de su hijo, Elijah Blue Allman, por problemas con adicciones
text: Elijah Blue Allman, hijo de [Cher](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/espectaculos/2023/05/25/oprah-winfrey-y-cher-aseguran-que-tina-turner-estaba-lista-para-morir/), ha luchado por muchos aÃ±os contra las drogas, aparentemente sin Ã©xito, pues vuelve a raer. Por tal motivo, la cantante ha solicitado la tutela del hombre, que actualmente tiene 47 aÃ±os. [Cher, quien en noviembre de 2022 habrÃ­a mandado secuestrar a su hijo](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/espectaculos/2023/09/28/cher-habria-mandado-secuestrar-a-su-hijo-dijo-nuera-de-la-cantante/) para internarlo en un centro de rehabilitaciÃ³n en medio de su reconciliaciÃ³n con Marieangela King, ahora busca ser tutora de Elijah, pues de acuerdo con ella, es â€œsustancialmente incapaz de administrar sus recursos financieros por sÃ­ mismoâ€. Â¿Por quÃ© Cher quiere la tutela de su hijo? SegÃºn documentos presentados en el Tribunal Superior de Los Ãngeles, mismos a los que tuvo acceso la revista People, la [cantante](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/espectaculos/2023/12/23/elsa-cori-encontrada-sin-vida-cerca-de-su-casa-en-puno-peru/) estÃ¡ preocupada por su hijo menor, quien podrÃ­a gastar indebidamente los recursos de los que dispone, incluido un fideicomiso que le dejÃ³ su padre, para usarlos y comprar [sustancias](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/nacional/2023/01/26/partido-verde-buscara-despenalizar-y-regular-sustancias-alucinogenas-para-tratar-la-depresion-y-ansiedad/). â€œElijah tiene derecho a distribuciones periÃ³dicas del fideicomiso establecido por su padre para su beneficio (â€¦) a (Cher) le preocupa que cualquier fondo distribuido a Elijah se gaste inmediatamente en [drogas](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/estados/2023/12/10/de-pelicula-narcos-en-tijuana-lanzan-caceria-contra-policias-que-robaron-cargamento-de-droga/), dejÃ¡ndolo sin activos para mantenerse a sÃ­ mismo y poniendo en riesgo su vidaâ€. Sin embargo, la tambiÃ©n actriz considera a su hijo incapaz de administrar sus finanzas por sÃ­ solo gracias a que no se encuentra estable en su salud tanto fÃ­sica como mentalmente. â€œActualmente no puede administrar sus activos debido a problemas graves de [salud mental](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/espectaculos/2023/12/10/que-problemas-de-salud-ha-tenido-alfredo-adame/) y [abuso de sustancias](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/salud/2023/05/02/combate-al-fentanilo-en-mexico-para-que-sirve-la-metadona-sustancia-que-escasea-en-el-pais/)â€, se lee en los documentos. Debido a esto, Cher ha tratado de buscar con su hijo un tutor temporal mientras Ã©l se somete a algÃºn tipo de tratamiento para dejar atrÃ¡s su [adicciÃ³n a las drogas](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/salud/2023/11/15/tramadol-medicamento-contra-el-dolor-que-provoca-adiccion-que-es-sintomas-y-efectos-secundarios/) y sustancias nocivas para la salud. Se ha programado una audiencia para una orden temporal el 5 de enero de 2024, y la que serÃ¡ para una decisiÃ³n permanente serÃ¡ el 6 de marzo. Cher busca lo mejor para su hijo Los documentos que se presentaron en el Tribunal Superior de Los Ãngeles tambiÃ©n seÃ±alan que las acciones que ha tomado Cher, incluida la solicitud de tutela sobre su hijo, son porque genuinamente estÃ¡ preocupada por Ã©l y su futuro. â€œ(Cher) ama inmensamente a Elijah y siempre ha actuado teniendo en cuenta sus interesesâ€, se lee en el informe presentado recientemente ante las autoridades. En octubre pasado, la cantante de 77 aÃ±os dio una entrevista a People y hablÃ³ sobre la preocupaciÃ³n que como madre siente hacia sus hijos, y dijo que por ayudarlos a salir adelante harÃ­a cualquier cosa. â€œSoy madre. Este es mi trabajo: de una forma u otra, tratar de ayudar a mis hijos. Haces cualquier cosa por tus hijos. Siempre que puedas ayudarles, hazlo, porque eso es ser madre. Pero es alegrÃ­a, incluso con dolor; sobre todo, cuando piensas en tus hijos, simplemente sonrÃ­es, los amas y tratas de estar ahÃ­ para ellosâ€.

author: Redazione di Rainews
title: Germania: la Volkswagen verso gli scioperi, respinte proposte dei sindacati
text:
Germania: la Volkswagen verso gli scioperi, respinte proposte dei sindacati Accordo non ancora raggiunto tra sindacato IG Metall e azienda. La VW chiuderÃ  tre fabbriche. Il tavolo dei negoziati riaggiornato al 9 dicembre 29/11/2024
Getty Sede VW a Wolfsburg La Volkswagen ha respinto le proposte del sindacato tedesco IG Metall di riduzione dei costi che includevano i bonus dei manager. I rappresentanti dei lavoratori si dicono ora pronti agli scioperi. "Sebbene possano esserci effetti positivi nel breve termine, le misure non porteranno ad alcuno sgravio finanziario sostenibile per l'azienda nei prossimi anni", ha detto l'azienda in un comunicato riportato da Reuters.
In particolare, la IG Metall - il maggiore sindacato tedesco che rappresenta oltre 2 milioni di lavoratori dell'industria metallurgica e manifatturiera nel settore automobilistico - ha proposto 1,5 miliardi di euro di risparmi sui costi, compresa la rinuncia ai bonus per il 2025 e il 2026. Il sindacato, dal canto suo, ha ribadito che i lavoratori della Volkswagen AG in tutta la Germania potrebbero iniziare un'ondata di scioperi visto il mancato raggiungimento di un accordo al tavolo con l'azienda. Si tratterebbe del primo sciopero su larga scala nelle attivitÃ  nazionali della VW dal 2018. Un prossimo incontro Ã¨ previsto per il 9 dicembre.
Assemblea di fabbrica della Volkswagen a Wolfsburg: "Nei prossimi due anni riduzioni salariali" 28/10/2024 Apri contenuto Manifestazione di protesta dell'IG Metall a Wolfsburg (Getty) 29/11/2024
Alle prese con costi elevati e con la concorrenza cinese, Volkswagen ha annunciato l'intenzione di chiudere almeno tre fabbriche in Germania, di licenziare migliaia di lavoratori e di ridurre la retribuzione del 10% dei dipendenti rimanenti. In Germania per la VW lavorano 300.000 persone: sarebbe la prima volta che l'azienda chiude impianti nazionali nei suoi 87 anni di storia.
Daniela Cavallo, presidente del comitato aziendale generale e di gruppo della Volkswagen AG, e Thorsten Groeger, negoziatore dell'IG Metall, 28 ottobre 2024 (Ansa) 28/10/2024 Negoziati Sciopero Germania IG Metall Volkswagen AG

author: RedacciÃ³n El PaÃ­s
title: La decisiÃ³n mÃ©dica que se tuvo que tomar para salvar la vida de vÃ­ctima del atentado con motobomba en JamundÃ­
text: Valle La decisiÃ³n mÃ©dica que se tuvo que tomar para salvar la vida de vÃ­ctima del atentado con motobomba en JamundÃ­ Se trata de un ciudadano venezolano que se dedicaba a cuidar las motos parqueadas en las calles del centro. [Por: RedacciÃ³n El PaÃ­s](/autor/redaccion-el-pais/) [En la tarde de este jueves, 20 de junio, Gerardo Mendoza, personero municipal de Cali,](https://www.elpais.com.co/valle/video-asi-llego-el-hombre-que-estaciono-la-motobomba-en-el-centro-de-jamundi-1211.html) confirmÃ³ que el seÃ±or Rafael Ãngel GonzÃ¡lez Araujo, vÃ­ctima del atentado con motobomba en JamundÃ­, quien permanece hospitalizado en la FundaciÃ³n Valle del Lili, tuvo que ser sometido a la amputaciÃ³n de un brazo. El personero de Cali, Gerardo Mendoza, visitÃ³ en laâ€” PersonerÃ­a de Cali (@personeriacali) [@FVLCali]a Rafael GonzÃ¡lez,el cuidador de motos que resultÃ³ gravemente herido con la detonaciÃ³n de una motobomba en el centro de JamundÃ­. El hijo menor de don Rafael, le confirmÃ³ al personero que a su seÃ±or padre le fueâ€¦ [pic.twitter.com/e4ZY2FNotJ] [June 20, 2024] De acuerdo con una publicaciÃ³n de la PersonerÃ­a de Cali en X: â€œEl hijo menor de don Rafael, le confirmÃ³ al personero que a su seÃ±or padre le fue amputado uno de sus brazos a causa de una bacteria ocasionada por las graves heridas que sufriÃ³â€. Vale recordar que Rafael Ãngel, es un ciudadano venezolano, quien se encontraba muy cerca de donde los terroristas ubicaron la motobomba, puesto que, [hasta ese momento, se dedicaba a cuidar las motocicletas estacionadas en el centro de JamundÃ­, como su medio de sustento.](https://www.elpais.com.co/valle/en-jamundi-no-funciona-ni-una-camara-de-seguridad-alcaldia-pide-apoyo-para-solucionar-esta-situacion-1240.html) Desde el miÃ©rcoles 12 de junio, dÃ­a del atentado, don Rafael fue atendido en la FundaciÃ³n Valle del Lili donde ha recibido la atenciÃ³n de especialistas que lograron estabilizar su condiciÃ³n de gravedad despuÃ©s de diferentes intervenciones, pero debido a una infecciÃ³n tuvieron que amputar su brazo derecho, dado que su vida estaba en riesgo. En declaraciones para El PaÃ­s, el personero de Cali, afirmÃ³ que en un â€œacercamiento con su hijo, me manifestÃ³ que a su padre le fue amputado el brazo derecho por una bacteria que le comprometiÃ³ su miembro superior, siendo su estado de salud estable y en evoluciÃ³n pese a sus mÃºltiples lesionesâ€. El personero de Cali, Gerardo Mendoza, entregÃ³ detalles del estado de salud del el seÃ±or Rafael Ãngel GonzÃ¡lez Araujo, quien resulto herido tras el atentado con motobomba en JamundÃ­. MÃ¡s detalles en:â€” El PaÃ­s Cali ðŸ“° (@elpaiscali) [https://t.co/tEOJH4tRTq] [pic.twitter.com/bxvnmOHI5y] [June 21, 2024] AsÃ­ mismo, el funcionario aclarÃ³ que estÃ¡ garantizando los derechos de la vÃ­ctima, â€œcomo quiera que el seÃ±or Rafael recibe atenciÃ³n mÃ©dica en la ciudad de Caliâ€. Por esta razÃ³n, se iniciarÃ¡ â€œtodo lo que administrativamente estÃ© a nuestro alcance para que su hijo sea reconocido como apoyo y se recepcione en la PersonerÃ­a de Cali la declaraciÃ³n del hecho victimizanteâ€. De esta forma, asegurÃ³ el personero Mendoza, se activarÃ¡ â€œla ruta a travÃ©s de la SecretarÃ­a de Bienestar Social y podremos institucionalmente asistirlos para brindar albergue, apoyo de alimentos, kit de aseo, kit de apoyo de arrendamiento, como estÃ¡ regulado, lo anterior mientras la Unidad de VÃ­ctimas reconoce a don Rafael como vÃ­ctima del conflicto armadoâ€.

author: newsdesk@nottinghampost.com (Neil Shaw)
title: Susanna Reid explains real reason she quit drinking
text:
TV presenter Susanna Reid has explained the real reason she gave up drinking after being asked about the move by Good Morning Britain co-host Richard Madeley. Discussing alcohol and the fact she didn't drink - Rucgard asked Susanna if she had quit for Dry January.
Susana actually stopped drinking alcohol six years ago on medical advice. While discussing New Year's resolutions and the fact she didn't drink, Richard asked Susanna: "Did you give up drinking because of a Dry January, because of a New Year's Resolution?"
Susanna replied: "No, I gave up drinking because a doctor said 'you should try giving up drinking for the sake of your skin'." She added: "I think sometimes if you've got a different motivator, other than just 'oh I'd quite like to give up drinking,' ... if a doctor says it's not good for you ..."
Richard asked why drinking is bad for your skin.
Susanna said: "It can make you look very flushed. And I was getting all sorts of breakouts as a result of drinking."
Susanna, who recently revealed she is also cutting down on coffee for health reasons, said improving her skin was a "proper motivator". She added that after giving up alcohol, if she ever had just one drink, she'd "instantly" notice its impact.
"Of course if you say to someone 'you're gonna cure your skin by giving up alcohol' that's a proper motivator. And then after I'd given up, if I had just one, I would instantly see it on my face. So it was a big demotivator for drinking," she said.
Susanna once said that she feels "clearer, sharper, and more energetic" now that she doesn't drink. She said it has "certainly helped" her," particularly when it comes to early mornings.
A spokesman for Universal Drugstore said the dehydrating effect of alcohol is bad for your skin. They said: "Dehydrated skin can cause premature ageing and more prominent fine lines and wrinkles. Give your skin a breather for a month and you will see improved hydration, swapping dullness for a healthier, glowing complexion."
Jamie Winn PharmD, at Universal Drugstore, said: â€œHealth benefits vary depending on your unique profile and lifestyle choices. Itâ€™s good to look at your overall diet, exercise regimen, and other habits too. While a month without alcohol can kickstart positive changes in fitness, maintaining a balanced and healthy lifestyle is key to achieving long-term health goals."
Dr Aamer Khan, Co-Founder of Harley Street Skin Clinic and Key Opinion Leader at Bio-Tech company,
ABG Lab, said: "Alcohol acts as a diuretic, so it has a dehydrating effect, which means that your skin loses fluid and nutrients that are vital for keeping it looking and feeling healthy. Dehydrated skin can appear dull, bloated or more wrinkled.
"Drink at least 8 glasses of water throughout the day and use the "one-for-one-rule" when drinking any of your favourite festive beverages. This means for every alcoholic drink, have a glass of water too."
Cosi Care founder Lauren Bell said alcohol can trigger eczema symptoms with itchy, dry skin.

author: VNExplorer
title: Forever Cheer picks Hong Kong as gateway for global launch of pain management drugs with an eye on US$88.2 billion market
text:
Forever Cheer Holding, a biotech company founded by Zhuo Min, a mainland-China-born neuroscientist who teaches at the University of Toronto, has picked Hong Kong as the base for global expansion with an eye on the chronic pain management market. The plan is in sync with the cityâ€™s ambition of establishing itself as an international biotech hub.
The global market for such products is projected to grow to US$173.4 billion by 2033 from the current US$88.2 billion, growing at a compound annual growth rate of 7 per cent, according to the New York-based research company Market.us.
â€œWe see the city as the gateway to the international market,â€ said Ted Chang Zongming, chairman and CEO of Forever Cheer, in an interview with the Post. The companyâ€™s goal is to establish a strong presence in China and â€œconnect the city to the global stage as they bring their breakthrough therapies to patients worldwideâ€, Chang said.
The company, headquartered in Hong Kong since 2015, has offices and production bases in Shanghai, Hangzhou, Qingdao and Ningbo in mainland China.
Its Fujian-born founder Zhuo Min moved to the United States in the 1980s and is now a neuroscience professor at the University of Toronto. The biotech start-up specialises in discovering new therapeutic targets within neuroscience research and developing first-in-class drugs which are prototype drugs that use new, unique ways to treat a particular medical condition.
The company is developing drugs targeting the inhibition of Adenylate Cyclase for both human and animal use. These drugs are currently undergoing various stages of clinical trials and have shown positive results in treating chronic pain without significant side effects or addiction risks, according to Zhuo, who is also the companyâ€™s chief scientist.
The pain management market potential was highlighted by pharmaceutical giant Pfizerâ€™s acquisition of Biohaven last year for US$11.6 billion. Pfizer said Biohavenâ€™s migraine drugs could top $6 billion in annual sales at their peak.
In the first half of 2025, the company expects to complete phase two clinical trials of NB001, a drug used to alleviate pain for late stage cancer patients, in China. Before launching the drug for humans, the company will start producing drugs for the treatment of chronic pain in dogs in China next year.
Scientists say the management of chronic pain currently involves opioid analgesics, anticonvulsants, and antidepressants but long-term usage has negative side-effects like diversion and addiction.
Selective adenylyl cyclase type 1 inhibitors could serve as potential alternatives for chronic pain management, Val J Watts, a professor of molecular pharmacology at Purdue University, said in a 2018 article in the Nature Journal.
â€œThe drugs can replace the existing cancer pain analgesics on the market and meet the current huge clinical demand for cancer pain treatment,â€ said Zhuo.
Preliminary data suggests these drugs are effective, presenting no significant side effects or risk of addiction, he said.
Forever Cheer holds over 10 global patents, covering various fields such as pain management, drug addiction, anxiety, and depression, with patent protection in major countries and regions worldwide. To support its research and development efforts, Forever Cheer has recently established its R&D headquarters in Hong Kongâ€™s Science Park.

author: National Research Council of Science and Technology
title: Efficient Solar Harvesting Even in High Humidity! | Newswise
text:
Newswise â€” The Energy & Environment Materials Research Division of the Korea Institute of Materials Science (KIMS), led by Dr. Dong-chan Lim and Dr. So-yeon Kim, has developed a highly durable flexible perovskite solar cell material and fabrication process that remains stable even under high humidity conditions. This breakthrough enables the production of high-efficiency solar cells in ambient air without the need for expensive equipment, offering the potential for significant cost reductions in manufacturing.
Perovskite has attracted attention as a next-generation material capable of replacing conventional silicon solar cells due to its excellent light absorption, low production cost, and ability to be fabricated into thin, flexible films. However, its vulnerability to moisture has posed a major hurdle to commercialization. As a result, manufacturing has typically required low-humidity environments or inert gas conditions. Furthermore, ensuring mechanical durability when producing perovskite in a flexible form has remained a significant challenge.
To address these challenges, the research team introduced a defect passivation strategy by utilizing two-dimensional (2D) perovskite materials to sandwich the light-absorbing layer of the solar cell from both the top and bottom. As a result, they successfully fabricated high-efficiency, durable flexible solar cells that operate stably even under relative humidity conditions of up to 50%. The solar cells also demonstrated outstanding stability, retaining over 85% of their efficiency after 2,800 hours of operation. Furthermore, the devices maintained 96% of their initial efficiency after 10,000 bending cycles, and preserved 87% efficiency in extreme shear-sliding tests, validating their mechanical robustness.
This achievement demonstrates a technology for fabricating perovskite solar cells without the need for expensive temperature- and humidity-controlled environments, while also exhibiting one of the highest levels of mechanical stability among flexible solar cells developed to date. Notably, the technology has also proven its scalability by being successfully applied to large-area continuous production processes, enhancing its potential for commercialization. It is expected that this advancement will accelerate the growth of the rollable solar cell and wearable electronics markets, while also promoting the industrialization of large-scale manufacturing processes and strengthening international competitiveness in solar energy technology.
Dr. Dong-chan Lim, the lead researcher at KIMS, stated, â€œWith this technology, it is now possible to manufacture high-efficiency perovskite solar cells in ambient air without costly equipment, significantly reducing production costs.â€ He added, â€œIn particular, the exceptional durability of the flexible devices makes them promising candidates for applications in wearable electronics and vehicle-integrated solar power systems.â€
This research was funded by the National Research Council of Science & Technology (NST), the National Research Foundation of Korea (NRF), and the Switzerland-Korea joint research project (SuraFlexi). It was conducted in collaboration with domestic and international research teams, including the University of Fribourg (Switzerland), Pusan National University, and Pukyong National University. The research findings were published on May 31 in the prestigious journal Chemical Engineering Journal (first author: Ph.D. candidate Mr. Fadhil).
In addition to this technology, the research team plans to continue developing next-generation solar cell materials that offer excellent durability across various domestic and international environments while reducing production costs. The team also aims to further advance large-area solar cell processing technologies to reach full commercialization.
